      • displayCompressed

        public void displayCompressed(int x,
                     int y,
                     int width,
                     int height,
                     int size,
                     RdpPacket_Localised data,
                     int Bpp,
                     java.awt.image.IndexColorModel cm)
                       throws RdesktopException
        Display a compressed bitmap direct to the backstore NOTE: Currently not functioning correctly, see Bitmap.decompressImgDirect Does not call repaint. Image is drawn to canvas on next update
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate within backstore for drawing of bitmap
        y - y coordinate within backstore for drawing of bitmap
        width - Width of bitmap
        height - Height of bitmap
        size - Size (bytes) of compressed bitmap data
        data - Packet containing compressed bitmap data at current read position
        Bpp - Bytes-per-pixel for bitmap
        cm - Colour model currently in use, if any
        Throws:
        RdesktopException

      • displayImage

        public void displayImage(java.awt.Image img,
                int x,
                int y)
                  throws RdesktopException
        Draw an image object to the backstore, does not call repaint. Image is drawn to canvas on next update.
        Parameters:
        img - Image to draw to backstore
        x - x coordinate for drawing location
        y - y coordinate for drawing location
        Throws:
        RdesktopException

      • displayImage

        public void displayImage(int[] data,
                int w,
                int h,
                int x,
                int y,
                int cx,
                int cy)
                  throws RdesktopException
        Draw an image (from an integer array of colour data) to the backstore, does not call repaint. Image is drawn to canvas on next update.
        Parameters:
        data - Integer array of pixel colour information
        w - Width of image
        h - Height of image
        x - x coordinate for drawing location
        y - y coordinate for drawing location
        cx - Width of drawn image (clips, does not scale)
        cy - Height of drawn image (clips, does not scale)
        Throws:
        RdesktopException

      • getImage

        public int[] getImage(int x,
             int y,
             int cx,
             int cy)
        Retrieve an image from the backstore, as integer pixel information
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of image to retrieve
        y - y coordinage of image to retrieve
        cx - width of image to retrieve
        cy - height of image to retrieve
        Returns:
        Requested area of backstore, as an array of integer pixel colours

      • putImage

        public void putImage(int x,
            int y,
            int cx,
            int cy,
            int[] data)
        Draw an image (from an integer array of colour data) to the backstore, also calls repaint to draw image to canvas
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate at which to draw image
        y - y coordinate at which to draw image
        cx - Width of drawn image (clips, does not scale)
        cy - Height of drawn image (clips, does not scale)
        data - Image to draw, represented as an array of integer pixel colours

      • drawLine

        public void drawLine(int x1,
            int y1,
            int x2,
            int y2,
            int color,
            int opcode)
        Draw a line to the screen
        Parameters:
        x1 - x coordinate of start point of line
        y1 - y coordinate of start point of line
        x2 - x coordinate of end point of line
        y2 - y coordinate of end point of line
        color - colour of line
        opcode - Operation code defining operation to perform on pixels within the line

      • drawLineVerticalHorizontal

        public void drawLineVerticalHorizontal(int x1,
                              int y1,
                              int x2,
                              int y2,
                              int color,
                              int opcode)
        Helper function for drawLine, draws a horizontal or vertical line using a much faster method than used for diagonal lines
        Parameters:
        x1 - x coordinate of start point of line
        y1 - y coordinate of start point of line
        x2 - x coordinate of end point of line
        y2 - y coordinate of end point of line
        color - colour of line
        opcode - Operation code defining operation to perform on pixels within the line

      • patBltOrder

        public void patBltOrder(int opcode,
               int x,
               int y,
               int cx,
               int cy,
               int fgcolor,
               int bgcolor,
               Brush brush)
        Draw a pattern to the screen (pattern blit)
        Parameters:
        opcode - Code defining operation to be performed
        x - x coordinate for left of blit area
        y - y coordinate for top of blit area
        cx - Width of blit area
        cy - Height of blit area
        fgcolor - Foreground colour for pattern
        bgcolor - Background colour for pattern
        brush - Brush object defining pattern to be drawn

      • drawPatBltOrder

        public void drawPatBltOrder(PatBltOrder patblt)
        Perform a pattern blit on the screen
        Parameters:
        patblt - PatBltOrder describing the blit to be performed

      • drawTriBltOrder

        public void drawTriBltOrder(TriBltOrder triblt)
        Perform a tri blit on the screen
        Parameters:
        triblt - TriBltOrder describing the blit

      • drawPolyLineOrder

        public void drawPolyLineOrder(PolyLineOrder polyline)
        Draw a multi-point set of lines to the screen
        Parameters:
        polyline - PolyLineOrder describing the set of lines to draw

      • drawRectangleOrder

        public void drawRectangleOrder(RectangleOrder rect)
        Draw a rectangle to the screen
        Parameters:
        rect - RectangleOrder defining the rectangle to be drawn

      • setPixel

        public void setPixel(int opcode,
            int x,
            int y,
            int color)
        Perform an operation on a pixel in the backstore
        Parameters:
        opcode - ID of operation to perform
        x - x coordinate of pixel
        y - y coordinate of pixel
        color - Colour value to be used in operation

      • drawGlyph

        public void drawGlyph(int mixmode,
             int x,
             int y,
             int cx,
             int cy,
             byte[] data,
             int bgcolor,
             int fgcolor)
        Draw a single glyph to the screen
        Parameters:
        mixmode - 0 for transparent background, specified colour for background otherwide
        x - x coordinate on screen at which to draw glyph
        y - y coordinate on screen at which to draw glyph
        cx - Width of clipping area for glyph
        cy - Height of clipping area for glyph
        data - Set of values defining glyph's pattern
        bgcolor - Background colour for glyph pattern
        fgcolor - Foreground colour for glyph pattern
